Donald Rumsfeld wrote that he never authorized waterboarding-- simulated drowning-- but he also called CIA interrogators who used the interrogation technique "patriots, not criminals." The questioning of those in department of defence custody provided information that saved innocent American lives. I make no apology for that, he also wrote. So he chided the team for their lackadaisical play. Final games of David West Coast trips are especially valuable because they can create momentum going home.
